Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Preoperative Internal Carotid Artery Stenting in Lateral Skull Base Paraganglioma Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a monocentric retrospective study

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included histologically confirmed paraganglioma, extensive vascular involvement, and ICA stenting followed by surgery.

Intervention.evidence: 26 patients with head and neck paragangliomas (19 tympanojugular, 4 carotid body, 3 vagal) underwent ICA stenting

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the role of preoperative internal carotid artery (ICA) stenting in improving surgical outcomes for lateral skull base paragangliomas.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the extent of tumor resection, assessed intraoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Due to the retrospective nature, randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Due to the retrospective nature, randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Gross total tumor resection was achieved in 85% of patients.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Gross total tumor resection was achieved in 85% of patients.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included one case of thalamus infarction, which resolved without permanent sequelae.
